alert.note: Alert for Cottonwood; Jackson; Murray; Nobles (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:15AM CDT until May 30 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR OSCEOLA...DICKINSON...JACKSON...NOBLES...MURRAY AND COTTONWOOD COUNTIES... At 313 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles north of Westbrook to near Lakefield to near Hartley, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Instrumentation. Observation site near Worthington, Minnesota recorded a gust 66 mph at 2:58 AM. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Windom, Lakefield, Jackson In Jackson County, Jeffers, Bingham Lake, Kilen Woods State Park, Spirit Lake, Milford, Arnolds Park, Bergen, Okoboji, West Okoboji, Terril and Superior. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
